result.execSummary:
The defendant Kameo Q Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Felony Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Stalking - Prev Conviction w/in 7 Yrs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as psychological evaluation and follow through. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victim unless approved by agent, family court, and victim or any other jurisdiction. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must be compliant with any child support orders. DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Sentencing hearing on August 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kameo Q Patterson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant has chosen not to go forward with trial but rather to accept a plea. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon plea to Cts 1 & 4 as charged, the State will move to DRI. Cts 2 & 3. The State indicates parties are free to argue.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kameo Q Patterson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is prepared. The defense is prepared. The Court reviews information with parties. Ludwig hearing conducted. The final offer is pl to Cts 1 & 4, Cts 2 & 3 would be DRI. The State agreed to follow PSI. Defense indicates defendant rejects the State's offer. The State has revoked all offers and they will not be reinstated. The State also indicates that with regard to the enhancer in Ct 4, the State proposes having the certified JOC entered and having Clerk Amy Vanderhoef testify as to whom the victim is in that file. The Court would take judicial notice of that document in either way. The Court calls the jury over. Jury enters, Oath #1 given. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by the State. Voir dire by defense. Parties exercise peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. Parties agree on the jury as chosen. Testimony will begin tomorrow at 8:30 am. The Court gives preliminary instructions to the jurors prior to being dismissed for the evening.
State's amended list.

Defendant Kameo Q Patterson in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Attorney Meetz appears via telephone. Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
JT is set for 6/9. Mr. Hastings indicates the essential witness was served May 15. Defense indicates they are ready proceed. No outstanding discovery issues from either parties. The State has filed MIL from the State. 
State's MIL are granted. No 904.04 issues or other acts evidence from either party. The State intends to use an expert witness and the State has received her CV. No objection by defense. The Court does not designate anyone as an expert and parties may ask the witness for their opinion to a reasonable degree of professional certainty. All witnesses are available on the day of trial for both parties. Anticipated length of trial is 2 1/2 days. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.  The Court will give prelim instructions: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101. Parties stipulate. The Court will conduct Ludwig hearing immediately before voir dire.
